1.name: Rope
1.description: Two men attempt to prove they committed the perfect crime by hosting a dinner party after strangling their former classmate to death.

2.name: The Red Shoes
2.description: A young ballet dancer is torn between the man she loves and her pursuit to become a prima ballerina.

3.name: Ladri di biciclette
3.description: In post-war Italy, a working-class man's bicycle is stolen. He and his son set out to find it.

4.name: One Sunday Afternoon
4.description: Biff Grimes has spent the last ten years regretting that he hadn't married Virginia Brush, the girl of his dreams. Virginia ran off and married his best friend - breaking his heart. Virginia's best friend, Amy, consoles Biff.

5.name: Luxury Liner
5.description: A young girl stows away aboard a luxury liner which is full of musical stars--and which her father just happens to be the captain.

6.name: The Treasure of the Sierra Madre
6.description: Fred Dobbs and Bob Curtin, two Americans searching for work in Mexico, convince an old prospector to help them mine for gold in the Sierra Madre Mountains.

7.name: Bud Abbott Lou Costello Meet Frankenstein
7.description: Two hapless freight handlers find themselves encountering Dracula, the Frankenstein Monster and the Wolf Man.

8.name: Key Largo
8.description: A man visits his war buddy's family hotel and finds a gangster running things. As a hurricane approaches, the two end up confronting each other.

9.name: Red River
9.description: Dunson leads a cattle drive, the culmination of over 14 years of work, to its destination in Missouri. But his tyrannical behavior along the way causes a mutiny, led by his adopted son.

10.name: Oliver Twist
10.description: An orphan named Oliver Twist meets a pickpocket on the streets of London. From there, he joins a household of boys who are trained to steal for their master.

11.name: My Brother's Keeper
11.description: War hero turned villain George Martin escapes from prison, but he is handcuffed to a naive young crook Willie Stannard. After using a clever plan to obtain railway tickets, and with the ...                See full summary »

12.name: Hamlet
12.description: Prince Hamlet struggles over whether or not he should kill his uncle, whom he suspects has murdered his father, the former King.

13.name: Fort Apache
13.description: At Fort Apache, an honorable and veteran war captain finds conflict when his regime is placed under the command of a young, glory hungry lieutenant colonel with no respect for the local Indian tribe.

14.name: State of the Union
14.description: An industrialist is urged to run for President, but this requires uncomfortable compromises on both political and marital levels.

15.name: Easter Parade
15.description: A nightclub performer hires a naive chorus girl to become his new dance partner to make his former partner jealous and to prove he can make any partner a star.

16.name: The Naked City
16.description: Two New York City detectives investigate the death of an attractive young woman. The apparent suicide turns out to be murder.

17.name: The Three Musketeers
17.description: D'Artagnan and his musketeer comrades thwart the plans of Royal Prime Minister Richelieu to usurp the King's power.

18.name: The Big Clock
18.description: After murdering someone, a magazine tycoon tries to frame an unknown, innocent man for the murder instead, while the innocent man tries to solve the murder himself.

19.name: Johnny Belinda
19.description: In post-war Cape Breton, a doctor's efforts to tutor a deaf/mute woman are undermined when she is raped, and the resulting pregnancy causes scandal to swirl.

20.name: A Song Is Born
20.description: With her gangster boyfriend under investigation by the police, a nightclub singer hides out in a musical research institution staffed by bachelor professors - one of whom begins to fall for her.

21.name: They Live by Night
21.description: An escaped convict, injured during a robbery, falls in love with the woman who nurses him back to health, but their relationship seems doomed from the beginning.

22.name: The Pirate
22.description: A girl is engaged to the local richman, but meanwhile she has dreams about the legendary pirate Macoco. A traveling singer falls in love with her and to impress her he poses as the pirate.

23.name: Blood on the Moon
23.description: Unemployed cowhand Jim Garry is hired by his dishonest friend Tate Riling as muscle in a dispute between homesteaders and cattleman John Lufton.

24.name: Superman
24.description: Superman comes to Earth as a child and grows up to be his home's first superhero with his first major challenge being to oppose The Spider Lady.

25.name: Sorry, Wrong Number
25.description: While on the telephone, an invalid woman overhears what she thinks is a murder plot and attempts to prevent it.

26.name: Macbeth
26.description: Macbeth, the Thane of Glamis, receives a prophecy from a trio of witches that one day he will become King of Scotland. Consumed by ambition and spurred to action by his wife, Macbeth murders his king and takes the throne for himself.

27.name: Isn't It Romantic
27.description: In rural 19th-century Indiana, the three daughters of a Civil War veteran are courted by three young men--one a sophisticated city slicker who sells phony oil stock, the second a local eccentric and the third a stolid country boy.

28.name: He Walked by Night
28.description: This film-noir piece, told in semi-documentary style, follows police on the hunt for a resourceful criminal who shoots and kills a cop.

29.name: Mr. Blandings Builds His Dream House
29.description: A man and his wife decide they can afford to have a house in the country built to their specifications. It's a lot more trouble than they think.

30.name: Portrait of Jennie
30.description: A mysterious girl inspires a struggling artist.

31.name: The Strange Mrs. Crane
31.description: Hoping to bury her criminal past, Jenny Hadley settles into a comfortable existence as Gina, the wife of the politician Clinton Crane. When her former associate Floyd Durant shows up to ...                See full summary »

32.name: The Fallen Idol
32.description: A butler working in a foreign embassy in London falls under suspicion when his wife accidentally falls to her death, the only witness being an impressionable young boy.

33.name: Another Shore
33.description: A young Irishman comes up with an unusual plan to get the money to emigrate to Tahiti.

34.name: Brighton Rock
34.description: In Brighton in 1935, small-time gang leader Pinkie Brown murders a journalist and later desperately tries to cover his tracks but runs into trouble with the police, a few witnesses and a rival gang.

35.name: Words and Music
35.description: Fictionalized story of the songwriting partnership of Richard Rodgers and Lorenz Hart.

36.name: Force of Evil
36.description: An unethical lawyer, with an older brother he wants to help, becomes a partner with a client in the numbers racket.

37.name: 3 Godfathers
37.description: Three outlaws on the run find a dying woman in the desert who gives birth to a baby. The mother entrusts the care of the child to the three men.

38.name: Letter from an Unknown Woman
38.description: A pianist about to flee from a duel receives a letter from a woman he cannot remember, who may hold the key to his downfall.

39.name: Yoidore tenshi
39.description: A drunken doctor with a hot temper and a violence-prone gangster with tuberculosis form a quicksilver bond.

40.name: Pitfall
40.description: Married insurance adjuster John Forbes falls for femme fatale Mona Stevens while her boyfriend is in jail and all suffer serious consequences as a result.

41.name: Anna Karenina
41.description: A married woman's affair with a dashing young officer has tragic results.

42.name: I Remember Mama
42.description: The ups and downs of a Norwegian immigrant family, circa 1910.

43.name: Melody Time
43.description: An anthology of animated vignettes set to contemporary music.

44.name: Joan of Arc
44.description: The abbreviated life of the 15th Century French heroine.

45.name: Ladies of the Chorus
45.description: A chorus girl falls in love with a wealthy young man, but their relationship is jeopardized by her mother's fears about the reaction of his family.

46.name: Germania anno zero
46.description: A young German boy faces the problems of the tough life in the immediate post WWII Berlin.

47.name: Quartet
47.description: Four of W. Somerset Maugham's short stories are brought to the screen with each introduced by the author. In the first story, "The Facts of Life", a young man with great potential on the ...                See full summary »

48.name: Wake of the Red Witch
48.description: During the 1860s in the South Pacific, Capt. Ralls, skipper of the Red Witch, has a series of adventures involving sunken gold bullion, pearls, natives, an unscrupulous ship owner and a giant octopus.

49.name: One Touch of Venus
49.description: Fantasy comedy about a young window dresser who kisses a statue of Venus, which then comes to life in the form of Ava Gardner. However, the problems begin when Venus falls in love with him.

50.name: Adventures of Don Juan
50.description: The great lover Don Juan comes to the assistance of his queen.
